verses.verse: ( Jesus before Pilate) ( ( 470 27:11-14 ; 500 18:28-40 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai Then ἀναστὰν <WG450> anastan rose ἅπαν <WG537> hapan whole τὸ <WG3588> to the πλῆθος <WG4128> plēthos council αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn . . . ἤγαγον <WG71> ēgagon [and] led αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [Jesus] away ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi to τὸν <WG3588> ton - Πιλᾶτον <WG4091> Pilaton Pilate .

ἤρξαντο <WG756> ērxanto they began δὲ <WG1161> de And κατηγορεῖν <WG2723> katēgorein to accuse αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou Him , λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes saying , Τοῦτον <WG3778> Touton this [man] εὕραμεν <WG2147> heuramen “ We found διαστρέφοντα <WG1294> diastrephonta subverting τὸ <WG3588> to - ἔθνος <WG1484> ethnos nation , ἡμῶν <WG1473> hēmōn our καὶ <WG2532> kai - κωλύοντα <WG2967> kōlyonta forbidding φόρους <WG5411> phorous payment of taxes Καίσαρι <WG2541> Kaisari to Caesar , διδόναι <WG1325> didonai . . . καὶ <WG2532> kai and λέγοντα <WG3004> legonta proclaiming ἑαυτὸν <WG1438> heauton Himself Χριστὸν <WG5547> Christon Christ , βασιλέα <WG935> basilea a King . ” εἶναι <WG1510> einai to be

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de So Πιλᾶτος <WG4091> Pilatos Pilate ἠρώτησεν <WG2065> ērōtēsen asked αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him λέγων <WG3004> legōn - , Σὺ <WG4771> Sy You εἶ <WG1510> ei “ Are ὁ <WG3588> ho the Βασιλεὺς <WG935> Basileus King τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the Ἰουδαίων <WG2453> Ioudaiōn Jews ? ” Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de - ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> apokritheis [Jesus] replied αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - ἔφη <WG5346> ephē - . Σὺ <WG4771> Sy “ You λέγεις <WG3004> legeis have said [so] , ”

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de Then Πιλᾶτος <WG4091> Pilatos Pilate εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen said πρὸς <WG4314> pros to τοὺς <WG3588> tous the ἀρχιερεῖς <WG749> archiereis chief priests καὶ <WG2532> kai and τοὺς <WG3588> tous the ὄχλους <WG3793> ochlous crowds , Οὐδὲν <WG3762> Ouden no εὑρίσκω <WG2147> heuriskō “ I find αἴτιον <WG159> aition basis for a charge ἐν <WG1722> en against τῷ <WG3588> tō - ἀνθρώπῳ <WG444> anthrōpō man . ” τούτῳ <WG3778> toutō this

Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de But ἐπίσχυον <WG2001> epischyon they kept insisting λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes . . . , ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - Ἀνασείει <WG383> Anaseiei “ He stirs up τὸν <WG3588> ton the λαὸν <WG2992> laon people διδάσκων <WG1321> didaskōn [with His] teaching . καθ’ <WG2596> kath’ over ὅλης <WG3650> holēs all τῆς <WG3588> tēs - Ἰουδαίας <WG2449> Ioudaias Judea καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἀρξάμενος <WG756> arxamenos He began ἀπὸ <WG575> apo in τῆς <WG3588> tēs - Γαλιλαίας <WG1056> Galilaias Galilee ἕως <WG2193> heōs [and has come] all the way ὧδε <WG5602> hōde here . ”

Πιλᾶτος <WG4091> Pilatos Pilate ( Jesus before Herod) δὲ <WG1161> de When ἀκούσας <WG191> akousas heard [this] , ἐπηρώτησεν <WG1905> epērōtēsen he asked εἰ <WG1487> ei if ὁ <WG3588> ho the ἄνθρωπος <WG444> anthrōpos man Γαλιλαῖός <WG1057> Galilaios a Galilean . ἐστιν <WG1510> estin was

καὶ <WG2532> kai And ἐπιγνοὺς <WG1921> epignous learning ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that ἐκ <WG1537> ek under τῆς <WG3588> tēs - ἐξουσίας <WG1849> exousias jurisdiction , Ἡρῴδου <WG2264> Hērōdou Herod’s ἐστὶν <WG1510> estin [Jesus] was ἀνέπεμψεν <WG375> anepempsen he sent Him αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . πρὸς <WG4314> pros to Ἡρῴδην <WG2264> Hērōdēn Herod , ὄντα <WG1510> onta was καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [who] himself ἐν <WG1722> en in Ἱεροσολύμοις <WG2414> Hierosolymois Jerusalem ἐν <WG1722> en at ταύταις <WG3778> tautais that ταῖς <WG3588> tais - ἡμέραις <WG2250> hēmerais time .

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de When Ἡρῴδης <WG2264> Hērōdēs Herod ἰδὼν <WG3708> idōn saw τὸν <WG3588> ton - Ἰησοῦν <WG2424> Iēsoun Jesus , ἐχάρη <WG5463> echarē pleased . λίαν <WG3029> lian greatly ἦν <WG1510> ēn he was γὰρ <WG1063> gar - ἐξ <WG1537> ex for ἱκανῶν <WG2425> hikanōn a long χρόνων <WG5550> chronōn time , θέλων <WG2309> thelōn He had wanted ἰδεῖν <WG3708> idein to see αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him διὰ <WG1223> dia because τὸ <WG3588> to - ἀκούειν <WG191> akouein he had heard περὶ <WG4012> peri about αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou Him καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἤλπιζέν <WG1679> ēlpizen was hoping τι <WG5100> ti a σημεῖον <WG4592> sēmeion miracle . ἰδεῖν <WG3708> idein to see ὑπ’ <WG5259> hyp’ - αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou Him γινόμενον <WG1096> ginomenon perform

ἐπηρώτα <WG1905> epērōta [Herod] questioned δὲ <WG1161> de - αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [Jesus] ἐν <WG1722> en at λόγοις <WG3056> logois [length] , ἱκανοῖς <WG2425> hikanois great αὐτὸς <WG846> autos He δὲ <WG1161> de but οὐδὲν <WG3762> ouden . . . . ἀπεκρίνατο <WG611> apekrinato gave no answer αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . .

Εἱστήκεισαν <WG2476> Heistēkeisan stood there , δὲ <WG1161> de Meanwhile , οἱ <WG3588> hoi the ἀρχιερεῖς <WG749> archiereis chief priests καὶ <WG2532> kai and οἱ <WG3588> hoi - γραμματεῖς <WG1122> grammateis scribes εὐτόνως <WG2159> eutonōs vehemently κατηγοροῦντες <WG2723> katēgorountes accusing αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou Him .

ἐξουθενήσας <WG1848> exouthenēsas ridiculed δὲ <WG1161> de And αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . ‹καὶ› <WG2532> kai even ὁ <WG3588> ho - Ἡρῴδης <WG2264> Hērōdēs Herod σὺν <WG4862> syn and τοῖς <WG3588> tois - στρατεύμασιν <WG4753> strateumasin soldiers αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐμπαίξας <WG1702> empaixas mocked [Him] . περιβαλὼν <WG4016> peribalōn Dressing [Him] in ἐσθῆτα <WG2066> esthēta robe , λαμπρὰν <WG2986> lampran a fine ἀνέπεμψεν <WG375> anepempsen they sent Him back αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . τῷ <WG3588> tō to Πιλάτῳ <WG4091> Pilatō Pilate .

Ἐγένοντο <WG1096> Egenonto became δὲ <WG1161> de - φίλοι <WG5384> philoi friends ὅ <WG3588> ho - τε <WG5037> te - Ἡρῴδης <WG2264> Hērōdēs Herod καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho - Πιλᾶτος <WG4091> Pilatos Pilate ἐν <WG1722> en vvv αὐτῇ <WG846> autē That τῇ <WG3588> tē vvv ἡμέρᾳ <WG2250> hēmera day μετ’ <WG3326> met’ - ἀλλήλων <WG240> allēlōn - ; προϋπῆρχον <WG4391> proupērchon before this [time] γὰρ <WG1063> gar - ἐν <WG1722> en vvv ἔχθρᾳ <WG2189> echthra enemies ὄντες <WG1510> ontes they had been πρὸς <WG4314> pros . . . αὑτούς <WG848> hautous . . . .

Πιλᾶτος <WG4091> Pilatos Pilate ( The Crowd Chooses Barabbas) δὲ <WG1161> de Then συνκαλεσάμενος <WG4779> synkalesamenos called together τοὺς <WG3588> tous the ἀρχιερεῖς <WG749> archiereis chief priests , καὶ <WG2532> kai - τοὺς <WG3588> tous the ἄρχοντας <WG758> archontas rulers , καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὸν <WG3588> ton the λαὸν <WG2992> laon people ,

εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said πρὸς <WG4314> pros to αὐτούς <WG846> autous them , Προσηνέγκατέ <WG4374> Prosēnenkate “ You brought μοι <WG1473> moi me τὸν <WG3588> ton - ἄνθρωπον <WG444> anthrōpon man τοῦτον <WG3778> touton this ὡς <WG5613> hōs as [one who] ἀποστρέφοντα <WG654> apostrephonta was inciting τὸν <WG3588> ton the λαόν <WG2992> laon people to rebellion . καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἰδοὺ <WG2400> idou here ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō I ἐνώπιον <WG1799> enōpion in your presence ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn . . . ἀνακρίνας <WG350> anakrinas have examined [Him] οὐθὲν <WG3762> outhen not εὗρον <WG2147> heuron [and] found ἐν <WG1722> en - τῷ <WG3588> tō vvv ἀνθρώπῳ <WG444> anthrōpō [Him] τούτῳ <WG3778> toutō vvv αἴτιον <WG159> aition guilty ὧν <WG3739> hōn of κατηγορεῖτε <WG2723> katēgoreite your charges κατ’ <WG2596> kat’ against αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou Him .

ἀλλ’ <WG235> all’ - οὐδὲ <WG3761> oude Neither [has] Ἡρῴδης <WG2264> Hērōdēs Herod , ἀνέπεμψεν <WG375> anepempsen he sent Him back γὰρ <WG1063> gar for αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . πρὸς <WG4314> pros to ἡμᾶς <WG1473> hēmas us . καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἰδοὺ <WG2400> idou As you can see , οὐδὲν <WG3762> ouden nothing ἄξιον <WG514> axion deserving θανάτου <WG2288> thanatou of death . ἐστὶν <WG1510> estin has πεπραγμένον <WG4238> pepragmenon done αὐτῷ <WG846> autō He

παιδεύσας <WG3811> paideusas I will punish οὖν <WG3767> oun Therefore αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him ἀπολύσω <WG630> apolysō [and] release [Him] .” ( BYZ and TR include 17Now Pilate was obligated to release to the people one prisoner at the feast; see and .)

Ἀνέκραγον <WG349> Anekragon they all cried out δὲ <WG1161> de But παμπληθεὶ* <WG3826> pamplēthei in unison λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes . . . : Αἶρε <WG142> Aire “ Away with τοῦτον <WG3778> touton this [man] ! ἀπόλυσον <WG630> apolyson Release δὲ <WG1161> de - ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin to us ! ” τὸν <WG3588> ton - Βαραββᾶν <WG912> Barabban Barabbas

ὅστις <WG3748> hostis ([Barabbas] ἦν <WG1510> ēn . . . διὰ <WG1223> dia for στάσιν <WG4714> stasin insurrection τινὰ <WG5100> tina an γενομένην <WG1096> genomenēn - ἐν <WG1722> en in τῇ <WG3588> tē the πόλει <WG4172> polei city , καὶ <WG2532> kai and φόνον <WG5408> phonon for murder .) βληθεὶς <WG906> blētheis had been imprisoned ἐν <WG1722> en . . . τῇ <WG3588> tē . . . φυλακῇ <WG5438> phylakē . . .

Πάλιν <WG3825> Palin again , δὲ <WG1161> de - ὁ <WG3588> ho - Πιλᾶτος <WG4091> Pilatos Pilate προσεφώνησεν <WG4377> prosephōnēsen addressed αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them θέλων <WG2309> thelōn Wanting ἀπολῦσαι <WG630> apolysai to release τὸν <WG3588> ton - Ἰησοῦν <WG2424> Iēsoun Jesus ,

οἱ <WG3588> hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de but ἐπεφώνουν <WG2019> epephōnoun they kept shouting λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes . . . , Σταύρου <WG4717> Staurou “ Crucify [Him] ! σταύρου <WG4717> staurou Crucify αὐτόν <WG846> auton Him ! ”

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de - τρίτον <WG5154> triton A third [time] εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen he said πρὸς <WG4314> pros to αὐτούς <WG846> autous them Τί <WG5101> Ti “ What γὰρ <WG1063> gar - , κακὸν <WG2556> kakon evil ἐποίησεν <WG4160> epoiēsen done ? οὗτος <WG3778> houtos has this [man] οὐδὲν <WG3762> ouden no αἴτιον <WG159> aition offense worthy θανάτου <WG2288> thanatou of death . εὗρον <WG2147> heuron I have found ἐν <WG1722> en in αὐτῷ <WG846> autō Him παιδεύσας <WG3811> paideusas after I punish οὖν <WG3767> oun So αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him , ἀπολύσω <WG630> apolysō I will release [Him] . ”

Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de But ἐπέκειντο <WG1945> epekeinto they were insistent , φωναῖς <WG5456> phōnais with loud voices μεγάλαις <WG3173> megalais . . . αἰτούμενοι <WG154> aitoumenoi demanding αὐτὸν <WG846> auton for [Jesus] σταυρωθῆναι <WG4717> staurōthēnai to be crucified . καὶ <WG2532> kai And κατίσχυον <WG2729> katischyon prevailed . αἱ <WG3588> hai - φωναὶ <WG5456> phōnai clamor ( BYZ and TR include and that of the chief priests.) αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their

ἀπέλυσεν <WG630> apelysen he released δὲ <WG1161> de As τὸν <WG3588> ton the [one] διὰ <WG1223> dia for στάσιν <WG4714> stasin insurrection καὶ <WG2532> kai and φόνον <WG5408> phonon murder , βεβλημένον <WG906> beblēmenon imprisoned εἰς <WG1519> eis . . . φυλακὴν <WG5438> phylakēn . . . ὃν <WG3739> hon - ᾐτοῦντο <WG154> ētounto they had requested , τὸν <WG3588> ton - δὲ <WG1161> de and Ἰησοῦν <WG2424> Iēsoun Jesus παρέδωκεν <WG3860> paredōken handed τῷ <WG3588> tō over to θελήματι <WG2307> thelēmati will . αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their

( The Crucifixion) ( ( 230 22:1-31 ; 470 27:32-44 ; 480 15:21-32 ; 500 19:16-27 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai - ὡς <WG5613> hōs As ἀπήγαγον <WG520> apēgagon [the soldiers] led Him away αὐτόν <WG846> auton . . . , ἐπιλαβόμενοι <WG1949> epilabomenoi they seized Σίμωνά <WG4613> Simōna Simon τινα <WG5100> tina - Κυρηναῖον <WG2956> Kyrēnaion of Cyrene ἐρχόμενον <WG2064> erchomenon on his way in ἀπ’ <WG575> ap’ from ἀγροῦ <WG68> agrou the country , ἐπέθηκαν <WG2007> epethēkan [and] put αὐτῷ <WG846> autō on him τὸν <WG3588> ton the σταυρὸν <WG4716> stauron cross φέρειν <WG5342> pherein to carry ὄπισθεν <WG3693> opisthen behind τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Ἰησοῦ <WG2424> Iēsou Jesus .

Ἠκολούθει <WG190> Ēkolouthei followed δὲ <WG1161> de - αὐτῷ <WG846> autō Him , πολὺ <WG4183> poly A great πλῆθος <WG4128> plēthos number τοῦ <WG3588> tou - λαοῦ <WG2992> laou of people καὶ <WG2532> kai including γυναικῶν <WG1135> gynaikōn women αἳ <WG3739> hai who ἐκόπτοντο <WG2875> ekoptonto kept mourning καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐθρήνουν <WG2354> ethrēnoun wailing αὐτόν <WG846> auton for Him .

στραφεὶς <WG4762> strapheis turned δὲ <WG1161> de But πρὸς <WG4314> pros to αὐτὰς <WG846> autas them ‹ὁ› <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said , Θυγατέρες <WG2364> Thygateres “ Daughters Ἰερουσαλήμ <WG2419> Ierousalēm of Jerusalem , μὴ <WG3361> mē do not κλαίετε <WG2799> klaiete weep ἐπ’ <WG1909> ep’ for ἐμέ <WG1473> eme Me , πλὴν <WG4133> plēn but ἐφ’ <WG1909> eph’ for ἑαυτὰς <WG1438> heautas yourselves κλαίετε <WG2799> klaiete weep καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi for τὰ <WG3588> ta - τέκνα <WG5043> tekna children . ὑμῶν <WG4771> hymōn your

ὅτι <WG3754> hoti - ἰδοὺ <WG2400> idou Look , ἔρχονται <WG2064> erchontai are coming ἡμέραι <WG2250> hēmerai [the] days ἐν <WG1722> en vvv αἷς <WG3739> hais when ἐροῦσιν <WG2046> erousin [people] will say , Μακάριαι <WG3107> Makariai ‘ Blessed [are] αἱ <WG3588> hai the στεῖραι <WG4723> steirai barren [women] , καὶ <WG2532> kai - αἱ <WG3588> hai the κοιλίαι <WG2836> koiliai wombs αἳ <WG3739> hai that οὐκ <WG3756> ouk never ἐγέννησαν <WG1080> egennēsan bore , καὶ <WG2532> kai and μαστοὶ <WG3149> mastoi breasts οἳ <WG3739> hoi that οὐκ <WG3756> ouk never ἔθρεψαν <WG5142> ethrepsan nursed ! ’

τότε <WG5119> tote At that time Ἄρξονται <WG756> Arxontai ‘ vvv λέγειν <WG3004> legein they will say τοῖς <WG3588> tois to the ὄρεσιν <WG3735> oresin mountains , Πέσετε* <WG4098> Pesete “ Fall ἐφ’ <WG1909> eph’ on ἡμᾶς <WG1473> hēmas us ! ” Καὶ <WG2532> Kai and τοῖς <WG3588> tois to the βουνοῖς <WG1015> bounois hills , Καλύψατε <WG2572> Kalypsate “ Cover ἡμᾶς <WG1473> hēmas us !”’ ( )

Ὅτι <WG3754> Hoti For εἰ <WG1487> ei if ἐν <WG1722> en [while] ‹τῷ› <WG3588> tō the ὑγρῷ <WG5200> hygrō [is] green , ξύλῳ <WG3586> xylō tree ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta these things ποιοῦσιν <WG4160> poiousin [men] do ἐν <WG1722> en [when] τῷ <WG3588> tō [it is] ξηρῷ <WG3584> xērō dry ? ” τί <WG5101> ti what γένηται <WG1096> genētai will happen

Ἤγοντο <WG71> Ēgonto were also led away δὲ <WG1161> de - καὶ <WG2532> kai vvv ἕτεροι <WG2087> heteroi others , κακοῦργοι <WG2557> kakourgoi [who were] criminals , δύο <WG1417> dyo Two σὺν <WG4862> syn with αὐτῷ <WG846> autō [Jesus] . ἀναιρεθῆναι <WG337> anairethēnai to be executed

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai - ὅτε <WG3753> hote When ἦλθον <WG2064> ēlthon they came ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi to τὸν <WG3588> ton the τόπον <WG5117> topon place τὸν <WG3588> ton - καλούμενον <WG2564> kaloumenon called Κρανίον <WG2898> Kranion The Skull , ( Greek Kranion; Vulgate Calvariae, rendered in some translations as Calvary) ἐκεῖ <WG1563> ekei there , ἐσταύρωσαν <WG4717> estaurōsan they crucified αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him καὶ <WG2532> kai along with τοὺς <WG3588> tous the κακούργους <WG2557> kakourgous criminals , ὃν <WG3739> hon one μὲν <WG3303> men - ἐκ <WG1537> ek on δεξιῶν <WG1188> dexiōn [His] right ὃν <WG3739> hon [the other] δὲ <WG1161> de and ἐξ <WG1537> ex on ἀριστερῶν <WG710> aristerōn [His] left .
